status.name: Closed

fields.description: As a user, I would like to the ability to attach ENI on run-instance request (cold attach) with Eucalyptus running in VPC mode, in a way that is compatible with AWS ENIs.

comments.body: I think we need to be more specific in the acceptance criteria that this is for a single IP per interface, not multiple. Secondly, the auto-config in the instance is the responsibility of the instance image itself. Eucalyptus is responsible for providing the proper DHCP responses, mac addresses, and data via the instance metadata service to enable the instance to configure itself. The acceptance criteria should enumerate those things or reference something that does so that it is very clear what is completed and what can be tested from within the instance.

ENI auto-config scenario is only covered by ec2-net-tools (not run-instances), which is compatible only with Amazon Linux. Users are responsible for the configuration of secondary interfaces (inside guest OS).

[~tsugawa], yes, I realized it after the Friday's demo and it sounds like lack of auto-config is consistent with AWS behavior in case of non-Amazon Linux AMIs. Would you mind modifying the acceptance criteria to reflect exactly what use would be expected to do to bring up the secondary interface? The main goal is to catch the expected behavior for testing and documentation.
